comment.text: Structural protein involved in the filamentous cross-bridging between microtubules and other skeletal elements.

3 different light chains, LC1, LC2 and LC3, can associate with MAP1A and MAP1B proteins. Interacts with TIAM2. Interacts with guanylate kinase-like domain of DLG1, DLG2, DLG4. Binds to CSNK1D (By similarity). MAP1 light chain LC2: Interacts with ELAVL4 (By similarity).
The basic region containing the repeats may be responsible for the binding of MAP1A to microtubules.
LC2 is generated from MAP1A by proteolytic processing.

property.value: Expressed in lateral nuclear group of thalamus and 233 other tissues
P:negative regulation of proteasomal ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process
P:negative regulation of protein localization to microtubule
P:positive regulation of cellular protein localization
P:positive regulation of protein localization to cell surface
